resources.string: Space smells like seared steak after spacewalks due to atomic oxygen reactions.
One day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
There’s a giant water cloud in space with 140 trillion times the water in Earth’s oceans.
Neutron stars can rotate hundreds of times per second.
Space isn’t silent—plasma and electromagnetic waves create eerie sounds.
Olympus Mons on Mars is the tallest volcano in the solar system, three times Everest.
Saturn could float in water because it’s less dense than water.
Black holes don’t suck; they just have extremely strong gravity.
Some rogue planets drift through space without orbiting a star.
Astronauts grow taller in space, up to 2 inches, due to spinal decompression.
Time passes differently in orbit; astronauts age slightly slower than on Earth.
Some exoplanets may be covered in diamonds due to carbon-rich conditions.
The Boomerang Nebula is the coldest place found, just 1 Kelvin above absolute zero.
A spoonful of neutron star material weighs about a billion tons.
There are more galaxies in the universe than grains of sand on all Earth’s beaches.
